name: Hyperbole
description:
Hyperbole is a 3D, first person, physics based puzzle game with action elements. You shoot an unlimited amount of large rubber balls at a high rate to propel a wooden cube through a Brutalist environment. Shoot buttons, interact with the environment, solve puzzles and win!

There are 13 varied levels, and a cute story to tie it all together!

Do speedruns, or take it slow and go for least amount of balls shot, or go nuts and go for most amount of balls shot, everything is possible with the built-in global leaderboard system!

The current version is a fully playable BETA, offered for free to the itch.io community so I can get feedback, improve the game and hopefully build a bit of a following to help me attract a publisher so I can finish and release it. Let me know what you think can be improved, any bugs you encounter, what works for you and what doesn't, ...

This game has been created by one person, as a spare time project over the last 4 years, with a total budget so far of 150 Euros. The dream is to find a publisher, spend some of their money on improving/finishing it, and then release it on PC (and maybe even console) as a commercial indie game.
